p: To our knowledge, there are few reports on essential oil compounds of Kundmannia species (Djarri et al., 2008; Faidi et al., 2014; Paksoy et al., 2016). Essential oil compositions of K. sicula from Algerian were analyzed previously by Djarri et al (2008) and those from Tunisian by Faidi et al (2014). Essential oil compositions and antimicrobial activity of K. syriaca and K. anatolica from Turkey have been reported for the first time by Paksoy et al (2016). However, Paksoy et al (2016) identified the essential oil constituents from the aerial parts of K. anatolica and reported that spathulenol (17.4%), curdione (4.6%), apritone (4.4%) and germacrene-d (4.5%) were the major components. Faidi et al (2014) reported that the major compounds of essential oils from the inflorescences with mature seeds of K. Sicula growing in Tunisia were identified as isocurcumenol (10.1%), hexadecanoic acid (10.9%), spathulenol (3.4%), 10-epi-geudesmol (.5%), a-cubebene (6.1%) and trans-dihydro occidentalol (6.6%).
